text: George Redburn Young (6 November 194622 October 2017) was a Scottish-born Australian musician, songwriter and record producer. He was a member of the 1960s Australian rock band the Easybeats, and with bandmate Harry Vanda he was a co-writer of the international hits "Friday on My Mind" and "Love Is in the Air", the latter recorded by John Paul Young (no relation). Vanda & Young were also the producers of some work by the Australian hard rock band AC/DC, formed by his younger brothers Malcolm and Angus Young. Young died on 22 October 2017 in Australia, aged 70. His brother, Malcolm, died a few weeks later on November 18, 2017. ==References== ==Other websites== * Albert Music: Easybeats Facts Category:1946 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Australian rock musicians Category:Australian guitarists Category:Bass guitarists Category:Australian pianists Category:Australian songwriters Category:Writers from Sydney Category:Musicians from Sydney Category:Musicians from Glasgow
title: George Young (rock musician)
